args: Is this article primarily about a new action or announcement by the Trump administration/White House/Executive? Respond simply with "yes" or "no" . House Republicans announce panel to continue investigation into Jan. 6 House Speaker Mike Johnson (R-Louisiana) announced a new select subcommittee to continue House Republicans’ investigation into the events leading up to and after the Jan. 6, 2021, attack on the U.S. Capitol. The committee will be chaired by Rep. Barry Loudermilk (R-Georgia), who in the last Congress led the conference’s investigation into the Jan. 6 select committee and the broader security response to the Capitol attack. It will be under the purview of the House Judiciary Committee, which is chaired by Rep. Jim Jordan (R-Ohio.) Loudermilk’s team published a 128-interim report last month chronicling investigators’ findings and has repeatedly said more work was needed to build on his panel’s findings. “House Republicans are proud of our work so far in exposing the false narratives peddled by the politically motivated January 6 Select Committee during the 117th Congress, but there is still more work to be done,” Loudermilk said in an emailed statement. “We are establishing this Select Subcommittee to continue our efforts to uncover the full truth that is owed to the American people. The composition and other details regarding the Select Subcommittee will be announced soon.” The effort is a part of the Republican Party’s broader push to recast the violent events of Jan. 6, 2021, and comes on the heels of Trump’s blanket pardon Monday evening of virtually all of the Jan. 6 defendants. He also commuted the sentences of the remaining 14, cutting short sentences for nine members of the Oath Keepers and five members of the Proud Boys, both far-right groups.
